commit_message:
no longer use oslo-incubator code

As part of the first community-wide goal [1], teams were asked
to remove the openstack/common package of their projects
if one existed. This was a byproduct of the old oslo-incubator
form of syncing common functionality.

- Most of the apiclient package was not actually used in code,
  only the exceptions were. So remove most of it.
- Copy the exceptions from apiclient to an existing top level
  location.
- Create an i18n module to remove the gettextutils dependency,
  this creates a new requirement - oslo.i18n.
- Remove a test (test_base) since it was testing the
  functionality of apiclient.base, which was not used in
  congressclient.
- General cleanup to other openstack/common references

[1] http://governance.openstack.org/goals/ocata/remove-incubated-oslo-code.html

Change-Id: I2f7f5d2d43e6a5c2e4dfe35266951efb4293093d

commit_message:
Allow to install tacker only env

Introduce a TACKER_MODE variable. If this is set to 'all', the
tacker devstack plugin will install other components just like
previous way. If it is set to 'standalone', the tacker devstack
plugin will disable all other services and enable the mysql,
keystone, tacker and horizon services.

Change-Id: I5d7613566ed45aa273848bfe85d76c7a7fe97ba1
Closes-bug: 1633327
Closes-bug: 1620163

commit_message:
Allow to override Idl class in OVSDB Connection

Add an option to neutron.agent.ovsdb.native.connection.Connection to
override the Idl class that is created to communicate with OVSDB.

This is a feature that would help in Dragonflow[1], where the notify
method should be overriden before start() is called, in order to receive
all events in real-time, and not retroactively.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/dragonflow/blob/d17ae9705a4f585fe3e87a398823dc983cf985c1/dragonflow/ovsdb/impl_idl.py#L135

Change-Id: I49da05f02a00352b1b1db863d244e97f9c148804
Closes-Bug: 1627615

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of
assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided
by testtools

Change-Id: I127045563897bccf77b2ba5a8975b2d7706ec3f6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-21 05:29:57.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/vnfm/plugin.py', 'tacker/vnfm/monitor.py'], 'message': 'Fixes event ordering for alarm monitor and scale actions.

1.Consolidates the two event captures in the update_vnf_with_alarm
method into just a single event capture with alarm url details.
2.Captures events in update_vnf_with_alarm method when policy action
and alarm action name are missing.
3.Captures the event information for ActionAutoscalingHeat policy
action invocation and scaling action in the right time order.

Change-Id: Iea255a4f454fb0c721b152090514ad8ca8732890
Closes-Bug: #1629453
(cherry picked from commit 09edd7badf57a1c1f45bc4ce6cd5e243cae3af76)

commit_message:
Fixes event ordering for alarm monitor and scale actions.

This commit adds code to support the below related to alarm
monitoring and scaling:
1.Consolidates the two event captures in the update_vnf_with_alarm
method into just a single event capture with alarm url details.
2.Captures events in update_vnf_with_alarm method when policy action
and alarm action name are missing.
3.Captures the event information for ActionAutoscalingHeat policy
action invocation and scaling action in the right time order.

Change-Id: Iea255a4f454fb0c721b152090514ad8ca8732890
Closes-Bug: #1629453
(cherry picked from commit 09edd7badf57a1c1f45bc4ce6cd5e243cae3af76)

commit_message:
Making Home directory consistent throughout

It is confusing to have different base home location
for different service.
This patch make base home directory common through out the services.
And it is recomended to create home directory using --home-dir flag while
adding user for a particular service.

Change-Id: I0db1b62fbc58288cd75328d74789e02b926a56c1

commit_message:
Fix resource-list with nested_depth in convergence

For delete we update stacks with empty templates and there are no
resources in the template to iterate for nested_depth. Use resources
from db instead.

Change-Id: I683094ef0507771660874ebb12d1f4e0c49363df
Closes-Bug: #1638787
(cherry picked from commit 4239a95d496582eac6117f9efef3ee866f9e0a2b)

commit_message:
Return condition functions based on the filter param

Add 'with_condition_func' filter param for API
template-function-list, if the param set to true,
the response will include the condition functions.

Change-Id: Icdfbafbb98698373648ff2d78db3c45fe2b924ee
Closes-Bug: #1625505
(cherry picked from commit 62f6045f2ad778edfc6e5305283e23cddc050ebe)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 17:50:37.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_cache/tests/test_cache.py', 'oslo_cache/_opts.py', 'oslo_cache/core.py'], 'message': 'If caching is globally disabled force dogpile to use the null backend

Due to the way caching is disabled the SHOULD_CACHE_FN() is used
to determine if new values are stored in the cache backend, and is
only called when the regeneration is required. If dogpile is
configured to connect to a memcache, redis, etc to store data
it is possible with caching disabled to still pull values from
the cache (SHOULD_CACHE_FN has no bearing on reads).

The issue described only impacts the use of the memoization
decorator.

This change forces dogpile to use the null backend if caching is
globally disabled to ensure no data is read from the external
cache. This will not affect subsystem disabling of cache.

Even with cache disabled but reads coming from the external cache,
there stale data is not a concern as invalidates will still be
processed and the data from the backend will eventually timeout
in most cases.

Change-Id: I845b6cc18faa2be516676eeacc574473ca84c995
Closes-Bug: #1567413
'}]
commit_message:
If caching is globally disabled force dogpile to use the null backend

Due to the way caching is disabled the SHOULD_CACHE_FN() is used
to determine if new values are stored in the cache backend, and is
only called when the regeneration is required. If dogpile is
configured to connect to a memcache, redis, etc to store data
it is possible with caching disabled to still pull values from
the cache (SHOULD_CACHE_FN has no bearing on reads).

The issue described only impacts the use of the memoization
decorator.

This change forces dogpile to use the null backend if caching is
globally disabled to ensure no data is read from the external
cache. This will not affect subsystem disabling of cache.

Even with cache disabled but reads coming from the external cache,
there stale data is not a concern as invalidates will still be
processed and the data from the backend will eventually timeout
in most cases.

Change-Id: I845b6cc18faa2be516676eeacc574473ca84c995
Closes-Bug: #1567413

commit_message:
Add required packages that aren't in a default Ubuntu install.

Add a small list of extra packages that are required to use the DIB
method to build an IPA image. Otherwise you get to try the build
over and over until you have all the bits installed.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-12 19:12:05.000000000', 'files': ['unstack.sh', 'lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': 'Remove call to undefined teardown_neutron_debug

Previously the usage of neutron debug ports was removed by
5e01c47e4d671166b9396c507a7105a5ac8256dc but there was still call to
teardown_neutron_debug. Recently a change to devstack-gate
1d6cc0771a3399300117f488e9d71e7ea46a4d82 caused that call to be
triggered and breaking the gate-devstack-dsvm-updown job.

Change-Id: Ifdacb0cec1307db469bd66f551474539184cf2cd
'}]
commit_message:
Remove call to undefined teardown_neutron_debug

Previously the usage of neutron debug ports was removed by
5e01c47e4d671166b9396c507a7105a5ac8256dc but there was still call to
teardown_neutron_debug. Recently a change to devstack-gate
1d6cc0771a3399300117f488e9d71e7ea46a4d82 caused that call to be
triggered and breaking the gate-devstack-dsvm-updown job.

This patch deletes the call and comments regarding setup_neutron_debug
and teardown_neutron_debug.

Change-Id: Ifdacb0cec1307db469bd66f551474539184cf2cd

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-11-11 09:47:27.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Update ironic node names for multinode case

Ironic node name is unique. This patch updates _ironic_bm_names()
function to generate uniq name for primary and subnodes.
On primary node node name is node-{id}.
On subnode node name is subnode-{id}. Where {id} is the node
number from 0 to $IRONIC_VM_COUNT

Related-Bug: #1622653
Change-Id: I7898426982b9fd89ac654a32e5d0b46d2a83dfcb
'}]
commit_message:
Update ironic node names for multinode case

Ironic node name is unique. This patch updates _ironic_bm_names()
function to generate uniq name for primary and subnodes.
On primary node node name is node-{id}.
On subnode node name is subnode-{id}. Where {id} is the node
number from 0 to $IRONIC_VM_COUNT

Related-Bug: #1622653
Change-Id: I7898426982b9fd89ac654a32e5d0b46d2a83dfcb

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-11-11 09:47:27.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Update devstack provision net config for multihost

This patch update devstack: configure_provision_network() function to work
with multinode case:

 * Ignore creating a new provision_network on subnode, just get an uuid for
   existed provision network.
 * Update IRONIC_PROVISION_ALLOCATION_POOL default value to left first 10 IPs
   for internal usage, exclude them from Neutron.
 * Add IRONIC_PROVISION_SUBNET_SUBNODE_IP variable, by default is 10.0.5.2.
   The IP address from provisioning network that is assigned to subnode.

Related-Bug: #1622653

Change-Id: I6c3ed6901ce5c5c94b6ad63a01d2875979a38ad5
'}]
commit_message:
Update devstack provision net config for multihost

This patch update devstack: configure_provision_network() function to work
with multinode case:

 * Ignore creating a new provision_network on subnode, just get an uuid for
   existed provision network.
 * Update IRONIC_PROVISION_ALLOCATION_POOL default value to left first 10 IPs
   for internal usage, exclude them from Neutron.
 * Add IRONIC_PROVISION_SUBNET_SUBNODE_IP variable, by default is 10.0.5.2.
   The IP address from provisioning network that is assigned to subnode.

Related-Bug: #1622653

Change-Id: I6c3ed6901ce5c5c94b6ad63a01d2875979a38ad5

commit_message:
Support soft reboot and poweroff in nova ironic driver.

Soft reboot/poweroff is now being implemented in Ironic. The spec is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186700/

This spec aims at enhancing 2 power interfaces in nova ironic driver.
1. Support server soft reboot
2. Support server soft poweroff

Change-Id: Ic49a6b782cb39aad38bb86fe08b585222f62298e
Implements: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <chen.tang@easystack.cn>
Co-Authored-By: Hironori Shiina <shiina.hironori@jp.fujitsu.com>

subject: Add command to remove IPs from inventory
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-11 17:12:30.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/developer-docs/inventory.rst', 'tests/test_manage.py', 'lib/manage.py'], 'message': 'Add command to remove IPs from inventory

This change adds support for removing container IP information from
inventory. This might be useful in situations where an environment is
deployed, but network information has changed, or there was a mistake in
subnetting (such as an expanded used_ips range).

Updating configs, such as LXC interface files and HAProxy or other load
balancers is not handled via this command.

Change-Id: Ibad9d587e14c41ecd486ed8668f9f815e348a94a
'}]
commit_message:
Add command to remove IPs from inventory

This change adds support for removing container IP information from
inventory. This might be useful in situations where an environment is
deployed, but network information has changed, or there was a mistake in
subnetting (such as an expanded used_ips range).

Updating configs, such as LXC interface files and HAProxy or other load
balancers is not handled via this command.

Change-Id: Ibad9d587e14c41ecd486ed8668f9f815e348a94a

commit_message:
Combine set_fact tasks

Where two tasks are being used to set the same fact depending on a when
clause, use a ternary filter to combine them into a single task.

Change-Id: I128781dfad54a9543dac79c2406f1e6808816025

subject: Automatically remove package deps
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-10 22:31:39.000000000', 'files': ['doc/metadata/rhel7/RHEL-07-020200.rst', 'tasks/rhel7stig/packages.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Automatically remove package deps

This patch adds functionality to enable autoremoval of dependencies when a
package is removed. This can be dangerous, so it is disabled by default.

Docs are included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ie88ffaec33249ac2ff03bf3d712533b382fac877
'}]
commit_message:
Automatically remove package deps

This patch adds functionality to enable autoremoval of dependencies when a
package is removed. This can be dangerous, so it is disabled by default.

Docs are included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ie88ffaec33249ac2ff03bf3d712533b382fac877

subject: Encrypt transmitted audit logs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-09 17:44:03.000000000', 'files': ['doc/metadata/rhel7/RHEL-07-030331.rst', 'tasks/rhel7stig/auditd.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Encrypt transmitted audit logs

This patch adds tasks and docs for RHEL-07-030331, which encrypts audit
logs as they are transmitted across the network.  Kerberos must be
configured in advance (this is noted in the documentation).

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ie9462c5cb3199b108fc1b87e5929a7c72ebda7ef
'}]
commit_message:
Encrypt transmitted audit logs

This patch adds tasks and docs for RHEL-07-030331, which encrypts audit
logs as they are transmitted across the network.  Kerberos must be
configured in advance (this is noted in the documentation).

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Ie9462c5cb3199b108fc1b87e5929a7c72ebda7ef

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-09-20 19:49:34.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/compute/nova.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/compute/test_nova.py'], 'message': "Read domain info from context when contacting nova

When we make a keystoneauth Session instance we are not looking at domain
info. This way we're always creating v2Password auth plugin, which will
obviously fail in an Identity v3-only scenario.

This patch makes domain information (i.e user_domain_id and project_domain_id)
be read from the context so that we can issue v3Password plugin as well.

Also, the logic behind auth plugin creation has been changed, as long as the
loading mechanism is designed to read options from config files, which is not
the case. Creating the plugin directly seems to fit better here.

This change is backwards compatible, since identity.Password can figure
out what Identity version is in use and will ignore domain info if v2.0

Change-Id: I687a73cce4230e1d98d5c42fdc81549d5bc6ab1a
Closes-Bug: #1599168
"}]
commit_message:
Read domain info from context when contacting nova

When we make a keystoneauth Session instance we are not looking at domain
info. This way we're always creating v2Password auth plugin, which will
obviously fail in an Identity v3-only scenario.

This patch makes domain information (i.e user_domain_id and project_domain_id)
be read from the context so that we can issue v3Password plugin as well.

Also, the logic behind auth plugin creation has been changed, as long as the
loading mechanism is designed to read options from config files, which is not
the case. Creating the plugin directly seems to fit better here.

This change is backwards compatible, since identity.Password can figure
out what Identity version is in use and will ignore domain info if v2.0

Change-Id: I687a73cce4230e1d98d5c42fdc81549d5bc6ab1a
Closes-Bug: #1599168

commit_message:
Add a build for Gerrit groovy-provider plugin

The groovy-provider[1] plugin is required to support the groovy
admin scripts[2] that we would like to run to help us renames
gerrit projects.

[1] https://gerrit.googlesource.com/plugins/scripting/groovy-provider/
[2] https://gerrit.googlesource.com/plugins/scripts/

Change-Id: Ia78e8bf76bc146aea422720742f9d09804f5ba27

commit_message:
Add periodic-frequent pipeline. Make periodic TripleO jobs use it

TripleO periodic jobs are used as promotion jobs. To get a bleeding edge
base for any downstream pipeline, they need to be run more frequently
I added a new pipeline called periodic-frequent that triggers jobs
every four hours.

Change-Id: Ie6fb790c13a892eda9485cc8d74c98a50473c8f1

commit_message:
Use ovs-interface-nondefault instead of ovs-native job

Currently of_interface and ovsdb_interface have 'native' by default.
So ovs-native jobs are unnecessary in master.
But a test case which doesn't use default as ovs-interface(vsctl and ovs-ofctl)
still needs to be checked.
This allows to run the test case with non-default ovs-interface on all
releases.

Change-Id: I93a61e63b0c8e0ba62cf58e25c74f7820dccb651

commit_message:
Changing arping command execute to accept 1 as extra OK code

Connecting any network to a router causes l3-agent to send out
gratuitous ARP packets that do not require a response. On Ubuntu 14.04
sometimes this command returns 1, which causes it to falsely report
arping command failure. This is now added to the extra OK codes.

Change-Id: I6299e936d4e4e7fd7497d23224e7abf605a99c15
Closes-bug: #1578842

commit_message:
Add build log location to translation proposal

Add URLs of build log of script that generated the proposal runs as
review comment. This will help to easier identify the logs in case of
problems.

commit_message:
Deprecate SR-IOV 'physical_device_mappings' config option

The device to physnet validation is made in Nova by pci_whitelist config option.
Therefore it is redundant to validate it in Neutron with physical_device_mappings
config option.

Closes-Bug: #1640220
DocImpact

Change-Id: I5f363347b327212a49a9b78a7164c11d9e457b10

subject: Cache file checksums by filename and mtime
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-10 17:34:34.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Cache file checksums by filename and mtime

The current cache only does by filename. An image could change out from
under a long-running shade process - so include mtime in the cache key.

Change-Id: Ibe649355fa123727b7b61af478e198a22b56aaae
'}]
commit_message:
Cache file checksums by filename and mtime

The current cache only does by filename. An image could change out from
under a long-running shade process - so include mtime in the cache key.

Change-Id: Ibe649355fa123727b7b61af478e198a22b56aaae

commit_message:
Revert "Remove neutron library"

Using the upstream library breaks the ability to test network plugins
that use 'local' neutron networks (ie. calico).

https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/issues/5589

This reverts commit 38b899b63b1fcb8fe62521068e178f8f0a4b1198.

Change-Id: I8a33db524c24324dc2af8463a43cb145f7cc34d6

subject: Avoid name errors in oneview periodics
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7711, 'name': 'Yuriy Zveryanskyy', 'email': 'yzveryanskyy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'yuriyz'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-10 20:53:42.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/oneview/deploy.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-oneview-periodics-0f535fe7a0ad83cd.yaml', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/oneview/test_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Avoid name errors in oneview periodics

Solves a bug that can brake the periodic task execution in
oneview drivers. The problem occurs when the method to check
if a node is in use by oneview raise an exception.

When that happens, the periodic task will break its execution,
leaving the node with a wrong provision state and wrong
maintenance mode too. The expected behavior when this occurs
is skip processing the current node, iterate over the next
node and process it.

This patch changes the periodic task execution flow, ignoring
the exception and processing the next node. In the next
periodic task execution, the not processed node can be
processed and updated accordingly.

Co-Authored-By: Xavier <marcusrafael@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: I4b4b350d82d9e6863e8a4f334d2f9e7f7c192c6e
Closes-Bug: 1629051
(cherry picked from commit 53521b6fd8bf01d8137b0a7cdb6504b3faf0b9ed)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid name errors in oneview periodics

Solves a bug that can brake the periodic task execution in
oneview drivers. The problem occurs when the method to check
if a node is in use by oneview raise an exception.

When that happens, the periodic task will break its execution,
leaving the node with a wrong provision state and wrong
maintenance mode too. The expected behavior when this occurs
is skip processing the current node, iterate over the next
node and process it.

This patch changes the periodic task execution flow, ignoring
the exception and processing the next node. In the next
periodic task execution, the not processed node can be
processed and updated accordingly.

Co-Authored-By: Xavier <marcusrafael@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: I4b4b350d82d9e6863e8a4f334d2f9e7f7c192c6e
Closes-Bug: 1629051
(cherry picked from commit 53521b6fd8bf01d8137b0a7cdb6504b3faf0b9ed)

commit_message:
Remove old lookup/heartbeat from IPA

Lookup/Heartbeat via vendor passthru was deprecated in Newton.

This patch removes the corresponding functionality from IPA,
and also removes handling of 'ipa-driver-name' kernel parameter,
as it was only used in code related to old passthru.

Change-Id: I2c7989063ab3e4c0bae33f05d6d2ed857a2d9944
Closes-Bug: #1640533

subject: Link to the user details from action log
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-11 14:25:05.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/audit_tables.py'], 'message': 'Link to the user details from action log

The "User ID" column in the action log is not very usable, showing
an unreadable ID of the user, instead of the user name. However,
getting the name of the user for every row could prove expensive.
Therefore, I'm turning the ID into a link to the user details page,
so that it's easier to see what user it means.

Change-Id: Ic07903a145ee4a3decc71f12717ed06e84fed0eb
'}]
commit_message:
Link to the user details from action log

The "User ID" column in the action log is not very usable, showing
an unreadable ID of the user, instead of the user name. However,
getting the name of the user for every row could prove expensive.
Therefore, I'm turning the ID into a link to the user details page,
so that it's easier to see what user it means.

Change-Id: Ic07903a145ee4a3decc71f12717ed06e84fed0eb

commit_message:
Trivial: Remove 'MANIFEST.in'

Everything in this file is automatically generated by pbr[1].
There appears to be no good reason to keep it around.
Note: we don't generate a MANIFEST.in in a file format from pbr,
but as input for setuptools.setup()

[1]https://github.com/openstack-dev/pbr/blob/master/pbr/packaging.py#L454

Change-Id: Ib26e99d64c0afb59f23c566201c465b6b99c5c7d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-11 19:24:30.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Set EVENTLET_NO_GREENDNS for IPv6 and dnspython compat

If dnspython is present it causes socket.getaddrinfo() to be
monkeypatched wiht code that does not work with IPv6. To get
around this, the EVENTLET_NO_GREENDNS environment variable
must be set before importing eventlet.

This is resolved in the eventlet upstream code [1], but has not
yet been released. Once our requirements have been raised past
the 0.19.0 release with a version that includes this change we
can remove this workaround.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/52b09becacd23f384cf69ae37d70c893c43e3b13

Change-Id: Id9fe265d67f6e9ea5090bebcacae4a7a9150c5c2
Closes-bug: #1471049
'}]
commit_message:
Set EVENTLET_NO_GREENDNS for IPv6 and dnspython compat

If dnspython is present it causes socket.getaddrinfo() to be
monkeypatched wiht code that does not work with IPv6. To get
around this, the EVENTLET_NO_GREENDNS environment variable
must be set before importing eventlet.

This is resolved in the eventlet upstream code [1], but has not
yet been released. Once our requirements have been raised past
the 0.19.0 release with a version that includes this change we
can remove this workaround.

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/52b09becacd23f384cf69ae37d70c893c43e3b13

Change-Id: Id9fe265d67f6e9ea5090bebcacae4a7a9150c5c2
Closes-bug: #1471049

subject: Modify variable's using method in Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-07 02:14:10.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/evaluator/scenario_repository.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code, 
rather than being done at the point of the logging call. 
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I8c724e11fb5fb3b34fb582b0029584e17df76d64
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code, 
rather than being done at the point of the logging call. 
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I8c724e11fb5fb3b34fb582b0029584e17df76d64

each specific resource.

This patch makes c-vol service work with this new table by adding
entries on cleanable operations and removing them once these operations
have completed.

Service cleanup on initialization has also been changed to use this new
table so hosts will cleanup only resources from operations they left on

hosts.

Change-Id: I4e5440b8450558add372214fd1a0373ab4ad2434

commit_message:
Make c-vol use workers table for cleanup

To be able to support multiple hosts working with the same resources we
have added the workers table to keep track of which host is working with
each specific resource.

This patch makes c-vol service work with this new table by adding
entries on cleanable operations and removing them once these operations
have completed.

Service cleanup on initialization has also been changed to use this new
table so hosts will cleanup only resources from operations they left on
the air and leave any operations that are being processed by other
hosts.

Specs: https://review.openstack.org/236977

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: I4e5440b8450558add372214fd1a0373ab4ad2434

subject: Add notice to nagios devstack installation
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-08 08:34:03.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/nagios-devstack-installation.rst'], 'message': "Add notice to nagios devstack installation

Install devstack with vitrage before install nagios via omd
to avoid apache2 pid issue.

Reason:
    - omd manages apache2 by itself
    - horizon and keystone are sites of apache2
    - stop apache2 via service will fail beacause of omd

When using devstack, remember to stop omd apache2's sites

Change-Id: If8c1dd9dfcb5ff7819db10c1cfa3d67c021a2feb
Closes-Bug: #1629811
"}]
commit_message:
Add notice to nagios devstack installation

Install devstack with vitrage before install nagios via omd
to avoid apache2 pid issue.

Reason:
    - omd manages apache2 by itself
    - horizon and keystone are sites of apache2
    - stop apache2 via service will fail beacause of omd

When using devstack, remember to stop omd apache2's sites

Change-Id: If8c1dd9dfcb5ff7819db10c1cfa3d67c021a2feb
Closes-Bug: #1629811

commit_message:
Set up stable/newton branch

Set up stable/branch properly:
* Disable all non-translated and non-versioned guides for translation.
* Only build backported guides (install-guide, config-reference,
  networking-guide).
* Publish backported guides and their translations to /newton/.
* Do not publish web pages.
* Update .gitreview for the branch.

Change-Id: I9e0729bafda930bc80e5c68b8e4cf15e7cb050ca

subject: Change 'name' field in action table
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-10-24 07:40:12.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_cluster_policies.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_clusters.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_webhooks.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_nodes.py'], 'message': "Change 'name' field in action table

When I analyze cluster_lock problem I find 'name' field in action table
end with short 'target_id'.But 'target_id' already in action table.
So maybe we use {'name': 'action_name_%s' % target.name} better.
Although the target.name can be non-unique it also can provie more
information than using short 'target_id'.

And some unit tests error use name as id to do test such as
in test_cluster_policy_attach.

Change-Id: I84379275353cefb97ecec181661a73c49e07d82c
"}]
commit_message:
Change 'name' field in action table

When I analyze cluster_lock problem I find 'name' field in action table
end with short 'target_id'.But 'target_id' already in action table.
So maybe we use {'name': 'action_name_%s' % target.name} better.
Although the target.name can be non-unique it also can provie more
information than using short 'target_id'.

And some unit tests error use name as id to do test such as
in test_cluster_policy_attach.

Change-Id: I84379275353cefb97ecec181661a73c49e07d82c

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-11 17:01:33.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_rbd.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connectors/rbd.py'], 'message': 'RBD: enclose ipv6 addresses in square brackets

When using ipv6, the IP address must be enclosed in square brackets
according to RFC 3986, Section 3.2.2.  Without this, an ipv6 cloud will
fail to connect to the ceph cluster prior to backup because the address
and port are not parsed correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1640914
Change-Id: I6501c7cdac38fe545d12e786448a8e0c0a4f6a25
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: enclose ipv6 addresses in square brackets

When using ipv6, the IP address must be enclosed in square brackets
according to RFC 3986, Section 3.2.2.  Without this, an ipv6 cloud will
fail to connect to the ceph cluster prior to backup because the address
and port are not parsed correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1640914
Change-Id: I6501c7cdac38fe545d12e786448a8e0c0a4f6a25

commit_message:
Add support of endpoint_type and region_name to clients manila uses

Since change [1] it is impossible to set endpoint_type and region_name
for nova, cinder and neutron clients that are used by manila in some
cases.
So, to fix it, add additional options called 'endpoint_type' and
'region_name' for each of config groups related to these clients.
These options can be defined in appropriate config group as following:

[nova]
endpoint_type = publicURL
region_name = SomeRegionName

[cinder]
endpoint_type = internalURL
region_name = SomeRegionName

[neutron]
endpoint_type = adminURL
region_name = SomeRegionName

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d

Change-Id: I6be0e77bbc0e4b1e9905eba7a7b48ff540e9e377
Closes-Bug: #1633454

commit_message:
Few changes related to the doc blueprint

1. * We need to either remove "Roadmap" from the index page completely
   and add it to some special article devoted to development or at least
   to move it to the end of the list
   (http://docs.openstack.org/developer/mistral/) - Done

2. * Article "Mistral Client / CLI guide" is messed up. Two problems:
   1) "Mistral Client" in this name is about installation which doesn't
   explicitly tell this (should be "Mistral Client Installation Guide")
   2) "CLI guide" is not about installation and should exist as a
   separate article. (http://docs.openstack.org/developer/mistral/) - Done

Change-Id: I9f2e7e24ce71e1c022b2918f455d805bab4740fe
Partial-Implements: blueprint mistral-doc

commit_message:
Configure civetweb bind socket via puppet-tripleo

When the civetweb binding IP is version 6 it needs to be enclosed
in brackets or the bind socket parsing fails. The mangling happens
in puppet-tripleo, this change updates the templates to push the
appropriate hiera keys.

Change-Id: Ic7004d768ed5e0f2382ffaa57961ea0ef9162527
Closes-Bug: #1636515
Depends-On: Ib84fa3479c2598bff7e89ad60a1c7d5f2c22c18c

commit_message:
Include lsb_release on redhat/centos7 images

TripleO deployment fails if lsb_release does not exist.
Typically it does exist as a transitive dependency of Ceph but this needs to be
an explicit dependency as Ceph is optional.

Change-Id: Idbef10b9b7aef0dcf0bafeb0f1cf6288d226297b
Closes-Bug: #1641106

revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2016-11-08 16:32:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api_models.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/api/test_migrations.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api_migrations/migrate_repo/versions/029_placement_aggregates.py'], 'message': "[placement] add a placement_aggregates table to api_db

In order to facilitate a future extraction of the placement service
we want to record the association between a resource provider and an
arbitrary aggregate uuid in its own table.

A PlacementAggregate model is joined from ResourceProvider via
ResourceProviderAggregate. Note that this structure is used so we can
join on ids instead of strings (the uuids). A direct mapping between
ResourceProvider uuid and Aggregate uuid was mooted earlier in the year
but was determined to be suboptimal.

The name 'placement_aggregates' is used as the least problematic of
several choices after discussion amongst several parties.

The data will be used by the forthcoming get_ and set_aggregates
methods on the ResourceProvider object.

Change-Id: Id0355cb022f68e962af306ff04cf724d22b68d19
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools-ocata
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] add a placement_aggregates table to api_db

In order to facilitate a future extraction of the placement service
we want to record the association between a resource provider and an
arbitrary aggregate uuid in its own table.

A PlacementAggregate model is joined from ResourceProvider via
ResourceProviderAggregate. Note that this structure is used so we can
join on ids instead of strings (the uuids). A direct mapping between
ResourceProvider uuid and Aggregate uuid was mooted earlier in the year
but was determined to be suboptimal.

The name 'placement_aggregates' is used as the least problematic of
several choices after discussion amongst several parties.

The data will be used by the forthcoming get_ and set_aggregates
methods on the ResourceProvider object.

Change-Id: Id0355cb022f68e962af306ff04cf724d22b68d19
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools-ocata

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2016-11-10 20:27:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_keepalived_state_change.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_lib.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_snat_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'releasenotes/notes/sending-garp-for-l3-ha-c118871833ad8743.yaml', 'neutron/agent/l3/keepalived_state_change.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py'], 'message': "l3-ha: Send gratuitous ARP when new floating IP is added

We rely on keepalived to send gratuitous ARPs when floating IP is added.
Older versions of keepalived up to 1.2.20 (exclusive) contain bug [1] where
keepalived does not send GARP on receiving SIGHUP. Unfortunately, newer
versions containing the fix are not packaged yet for some distributions
like RHEL or CentOS or Ubuntu Xenial, so this patch adds a workaround for
such distributions until new packages are available.

The patch also sets net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind kernel parameter to 0 for
Snat and HA router namespaces in order to avoid sending gratuitous ARPs
for IP addresses that are not bound to the interface anymore - possibly
because of failover or removal. Note that kernel < 3.19 contain a bug
where this knob is missing. In case it attempts to set the parameter and
it's missing on the system, it doesn't set the knob in root
namespace like it's done for fip namespaces, but only issues a warning
message.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1391553

Change-Id: Ieab53624dc34dc687a0e8eebd84778f7fc95dd77
Closes-bug: 1639315
"}]
commit_message:
l3-ha: Send gratuitous ARP when new floating IP is added

We rely on keepalived to send gratuitous ARPs when floating IP is added.
Older versions of keepalived up to 1.2.20 (exclusive) contain bug [1] where
keepalived does not send GARP on receiving SIGHUP. Unfortunately, newer
versions containing the fix are not packaged yet for some distributions
like RHEL or CentOS or Ubuntu Xenial, so this patch adds a workaround for
such distributions until new packages are available.

The patch also sets net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind kernel parameter to 0 for
Snat and HA router namespaces in order to avoid sending gratuitous ARPs
for IP addresses that are not bound to the interface anymore - possibly
because of failover or removal. Note that kernel < 3.19 contain a bug
where this knob is missing. In case it attempts to set the parameter and
it's missing on the system, it doesn't set the knob in root
namespace like it's done for fip namespaces, but only issues a warning
message.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1391553

Change-Id: Ieab53624dc34dc687a0e8eebd84778f7fc95dd77
Closes-bug: 1639315

commit_message:
Pass MTU into os-vif Network object

This passes the MTU from the network_info into the
constructed os-vif object so it can be used by the
os-vif plugging libraries to set the correct MTU.

Now with os-vif >=1.3.0 in the global requirements,
os-vif has correct support for MTUs on the os-vif
objects so we can use them correctly.

The follow-up patch removes the MTU hacks that were
added last minute for the related bug.

Related-Bug: #1623876
Change-Id: Iae0d83d22511f35f00ed6d8fde03f8c32dbedb26

1) Introduced an environment variable UNSTACK_KEEP_ODL
   (default False). Once setting to True, do not remove
   ODL while unstacking.
2) gate_hook.sh -- script to hijack gate job from running
   actual tests.
3) post_test_hook.sh -- actual fullstack testing is invoked here.

Partial-Bug: 1633239

Change-Id: I3a62313529978a36884dab3073d1c2b164136a07
'}]
commit_message:
Scripts to enable fullstack testing in gate

1) Introduced an environment variable UNSTACK_KEEP_ODL
   (default False). Once setting to True, do not remove
   ODL while unstacking.
2) gate_hook.sh -- script to hijack gate job from running
   actual tests.
3) post_test_hook.sh -- actual fullstack testing is invoked here.

Partial-Bug: 1633239

Change-Id: I3a62313529978a36884dab3073d1c2b164136a07

                                     ref=self.user,

commit_message:
Added named argument to response test functions

The test function such as assertValidUserListResponse() and
assertValidUserResponse() are called in different style:

    self.assertValidUserListResponse(r,
                                     ref=self.user,
                                     resource_url=resource_url)
    self.assertValidUserResponse(r, user)

Although this won't cause any problem, but it would be better to unify
the function call by add named argument calling to all assert valid
response functions.

Closes-Bug: #1591916
Change-Id: I7ca3266ff05b0a999666ad01886d741379cea319

subject: Increase the default token lifespan
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-20 22:44:21.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/conf/token.py'], 'message': "Increase the default token lifespan

Reasons for the current (short) token lifespan:

- (Performance) A short token lifespan reduces the number of
  simultaneously-valid UUID, PKI, and PKIZ tokens in the database (or in
  memcached). This is not an issue for Fernet tokens, which are not
  persisted, anyway.

- (Security) We used to not be great about hiding bearer tokens from
  logs, HTTP requests, etc. We've gotten better, to say the least.

Problems with the current (short) token lifespan:

- (Use case) They break long-running processes when the token expires
  before the process completes. Alternative solutions to addressing this
  use case without increasing the expiration are complicated.

- (Performance) Users have to re-authenticate more frequently.

Drawbacks to increasing the token lifespan:

- (Security) Increased exposure for compromised bearer tokens.

Change-Id: I062a220471009b53ed6e24ee571feca9158fb650
"}]
commit_message:
Increase the default token lifespan

Reasons for the current (short) token lifespan:

- (Performance) A short token lifespan reduces the number of
  simultaneously-valid UUID, PKI, and PKIZ tokens in the database (or in
  memcached). This is not an issue for Fernet tokens, which are not
  persisted, anyway.

- (Security) We used to not be great about hiding bearer tokens from
  logs, HTTP requests, etc. We've gotten better, to say the least.

Problems with the current (short) token lifespan:

- (Use case) They break long-running processes when the token expires
  before the process completes. Alternative solutions to addressing this
  use case without increasing the expiration are complicated.

- (Performance) Users have to re-authenticate more frequently.

Drawbacks to increasing the token lifespan:

- (Security) Increased exposure for compromised bearer tokens.

Change-Id: I062a220471009b53ed6e24ee571feca9158fb650

commit_message:
Revert MTU hacks for bug 1623876

Now with the native support for MTUs in the os-vif data model,
we no longer require the MTU hacks added at the end of Newton
to honor the MTUs set by Neutron.

Revert "Stop ovn networking failing on mtu"
This reverts commit fc0e281743917dbda25fb1911500439abed192ca.
Revert "Override MTU for os_vif attachments"
This reverts commit 77f546623bb6c0b2a4441940f1740abd45bd3352.

Related-Bug: #1623876
Change-Id: I82d7a1630e81254dfd6196d51add19ac2cbc5bdb

subject: Add default project_id to user ref on role grant
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-29 19:58:14.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/auth/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_resource.py', 'keystone/assignment/core.py'], 'message': 'Add default project_id to user ref on role grant

it was observed on Mitaka that if a project is not specified during user
creation then no default_project_id field is added in the user
reference. Even if a subsequent role grant maps a project to this user,
no default_project_id is added to the user reference.  This has the
disadvantage of having Horizon show ProjectID (for that user) show up
as blank or None.

The fix is to recognize a role grant and add a default_project_id
if not present within the user reference

Change-Id: Ifefa97fdd6f65b9de672b7eeaba5e5d996e3fa33
Closes-Bug: 1604479
Signed-off-by: Kam Nasim <kam.nasim@windriver.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add default project_id to user ref on role grant

it was observed on Mitaka that if a project is not specified during user
creation then no default_project_id field is added in the user
reference. Even if a subsequent role grant maps a project to this user,
no default_project_id is added to the user reference.  This has the
disadvantage of having Horizon show ProjectID (for that user) show up
as blank or None.

The fix is to recognize a role grant and add a default_project_id
if not present within the user reference

Change-Id: Ifefa97fdd6f65b9de672b7eeaba5e5d996e3fa33
Closes-Bug: 1604479
Signed-off-by: Kam Nasim <kam.nasim@windriver.com>

Upcoming changes will add new methods to the identity drivers, so
in preparation for that we create a new versioned driver.

In order to allow the use of a legacy driver, one of the unit tests
had to be changed. Further, in order to maintain distinct models
for Identity, the copy of the sql driver for legacy testing required
all the classes/tables names to be given the V8 suffix.

Limitations:

The Shadow user driver interface loads and makes calls to the base
identity drivers. Currently this cannot load the legacy version,
meaning that the federated shadow users driver methods are not
tested against the legacy driver.

Change-Id: I52c75f651d8d8a91eaca451be614fce46ad4be30
Partial-Bug: #1523369
'}]
commit_message:
Create V9 driver for identity backend

Upcoming changes will add new methods to the identity drivers, so
in preparation for that we create a new versioned driver.

In order to allow the use of a legacy driver, one of the unit tests
had to be changed. Further, in order to maintain distinct models
for Identity, the copy of the sql driver for legacy testing required
all the classes/tables names to be given the V8 suffix.

Limitations:

The Shadow user driver interface loads and makes calls to the base
identity drivers. Currently this cannot load the legacy version,
meaning that the federated shadow users driver methods are not
tested against the legacy driver.

Change-Id: I52c75f651d8d8a91eaca451be614fce46ad4be30
Partial-Bug: #1523369

commit_message:
Fixes a variable usage issue

``service_id`` is defined as a path variable and is used to show the
response body too. What we really want is ``service_id_1`` because it is
defined as a body parameter

Change-Id: I6746b360cc9fd809cde29262316eefc5ab84105f

There is one app which handles /v3 requests for public and admin
endpoints, so in case if public_endpoint and admin_endpoint are
specified in config URL the public endpoint is always returned.

This fix uses request's port to decide admin or public endpoint is

Closes-Bug: #1381961

commit_message:
Return correct endpoint URL in /v3 response

There is one app which handles /v3 requests for public and admin
endpoints, so in case if public_endpoint and admin_endpoint are
specified in config URL the public endpoint is always returned.

This fix uses request's port to decide admin or public endpoint is
requested and returns the correct endpoint URL.

Change-Id: I5451c5f4d7b132e60d860138d809c0e5aebae90a
Closes-Bug: #1381961

It has been renamed to parse_image_tag() as its in common location
and not specific to docker only

2. Allows image_pull() to take repo and tag as separate arguements.
This is done because in case if image driver is glance then it gives
an error when repo contains tag name

NOTE1: This patch does not validate repo names. Thats out of scope
of this patch and will be handled in separate patch

NOTE2: As of now metadata of glance driver is not stored anywhere so
glance driver takes tag as argument but do not really uses it

Change-Id: Iaa6987b1f479dd0f67e9d4f5a2d318f30e2e2589
Closes-Bug: 1634518

commit_message:
Move "parse_docker_image()" to zun/common/utils.py

This patch does folllowing 2 things :
1. Move parse_docker_image() to zun/common/utils.py
It has been renamed to parse_image_tag() as its in common location
and not specific to docker only

2. Allows image_pull() to take repo and tag as separate arguements.
This is done because in case if image driver is glance then it gives
an error when repo contains tag name

NOTE1: This patch does not validate repo names. Thats out of scope
of this patch and will be handled in separate patch

NOTE2: As of now metadata of glance driver is not stored anywhere so
glance driver takes tag as argument but do not really uses it

Change-Id: Iaa6987b1f479dd0f67e9d4f5a2d318f30e2e2589
Closes-Bug: 1634518

commit_message:
[Docs] Restructuring

* Moves the remaining guides from the Draft folder
* Removes already rewritten articles (Murano TroubleShooting and Debug Tips)
* Restructures the main page
* Fixes build errors
* Adds minor editorial changes to some sections

Change-Id: I1aa961f34860b22241b69d41045da445d223be06
Partial-Bug: #1603950

subject: Only use parameter_defaults for scaling down
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-12 00:41:28.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/actions/test_scale.py', 'tripleo_common/actions/scale.py'], 'message': "Only use parameter_defaults for scaling down

We were using parameters for scaling down but parameter_defaults for
scaling up. The old parameters from scale-down still persisted in the
stack and took precedence over the scaled-up parameter_defaults, so the
scaled-up values didn't propagate.

We already update parameter_defaults in the deployment plan in that same
method, so all we need to do is remove the 'parameters' part.

Change-Id: I90a195a66b15c7c9057bfb415b6a730bbd9a939c
Closes-Bug: #1641142
(cherry picked from commit fbc435ce167eae2c6ac1070be47ad9065561855b)
"}]
commit_message:
Only use parameter_defaults for scaling down

We were using parameters for scaling down but parameter_defaults for
scaling up. The old parameters from scale-down still persisted in the
stack and took precedence over the scaled-up parameter_defaults, so the
scaled-up values didn't propagate.

We already update parameter_defaults in the deployment plan in that same
method, so all we need to do is remove the 'parameters' part.

Change-Id: I90a195a66b15c7c9057bfb415b6a730bbd9a939c
Closes-Bug: #1641142
(cherry picked from commit fbc435ce167eae2c6ac1070be47ad9065561855b)

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-11-08 11:31:38.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_db_api.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_admin_actions.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/db/test_name_id.py'], 'message': "DB: Optimize volume_update method

Our current volume_update method reads the volume from the DB, joining
the volume table with 4 or 5 other tables, and then do the update using
SQLAlchemy ORM engine before returning updated ORM object.

But the truth is that we don't really need to retrieve the volume again
in any of existing cases, since the caller either doesn't care about
current value in the DB -for example when setting status to error- or it
already has that information -composing it with the current value it has
and the updated fields it's passing- and doesn't need to reload it.

This additional joined read from the DB on every volume update is
creating unnecessary load on the DB and reducing our network capacity
and in other resources we are not retrieving it either.

This patch modifies the way we do updates so we don't read current DB
values.

Change-Id: I92e76eb8eb64ac96995b29017c7683a564dc5e0e
"}]
commit_message:
DB: Optimize volume_update method

Our current volume_update method reads the volume from the DB, joining
the volume table with 4 or 5 other tables, and then do the update using
SQLAlchemy ORM engine before returning updated ORM object.

But the truth is that we don't really need to retrieve the volume again
in any of existing cases, since the caller either doesn't care about
current value in the DB -for example when setting status to error- or it
already has that information -composing it with the current value it has
and the updated fields it's passing- and doesn't need to reload it.

This additional joined read from the DB on every volume update is
creating unnecessary load on the DB and reducing our network capacity
and in other resources we are not retrieving it either.

This patch modifies the way we do updates so we don't read current DB
values.

Change-Id: I92e76eb8eb64ac96995b29017c7683a564dc5e0e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-11 20:42:44.000000000', 'files': ['environments/low-memory-usage.yaml'], 'message': "Increasing neutron timeout for low memory usage

We are noticing several tests failing in our low memory environment
because of timeout in neutron requests.
As an example the test
tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON
fails because it requests to plug a vif, and send request to neutron,
which responds in more than neutron_url_timeout, and since the option
vif_plugging_is_fatal is set to True as default, the test fails.
Shortly thereafter, checking in neutron log you can see the request,
returning with the proper status, after more than neutron_url_timeout,
however, it's already too late once nova already marked the instance
with error status, and so the test fails.

Closes-Bug: #1641135

Change-Id: If0991c114f199490ac0deb71eb569a42d4711359
(cherry picked from commit c99c48b84e20925b4f4b728e9b103d6c8bcb3d11)
"}]
commit_message:
Increasing neutron timeout for low memory usage

We are noticing several tests failing in our low memory environment
because of timeout in neutron requests.
As an example the test
tempest.api.compute.servers.test_server_actions.ServerActionsTestJSON
fails because it requests to plug a vif, and send request to neutron,
which responds in more than neutron_url_timeout, and since the option
vif_plugging_is_fatal is set to True as default, the test fails.
Shortly thereafter, checking in neutron log you can see the request,
returning with the proper status, after more than neutron_url_timeout,
however, it's already too late once nova already marked the instance
with error status, and so the test fails.

Closes-Bug: #1641135

Change-Id: If0991c114f199490ac0deb71eb569a42d4711359
(cherry picked from commit c99c48b84e20925b4f4b728e9b103d6c8bcb3d11)

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 15:22:33.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/nfs_base.py'], 'message': "NetApp NFS: Look for new file for >60s

The default lookup cache expiry time for the
Linux NFS client is 60 seconds.  This means that
looking for a new file could fail for the current
45 seconds, but if the driver looks for >60s, the
cache will be refreshed, and the file's presence
will be detected.

This means that we don't have to change the NFS
client mount options to compensate for this cache
behavior.

Change-Id: I8c63fe6b8c5de74eac3f3c259783bb946e0482a0
Closes-Bug: #1608596
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp NFS: Look for new file for >60s

The default lookup cache expiry time for the
Linux NFS client is 60 seconds.  This means that
looking for a new file could fail for the current
45 seconds, but if the driver looks for >60s, the
cache will be refreshed, and the file's presence
will be detected.

This means that we don't have to change the NFS
client mount options to compensate for this cache
behavior.

Change-Id: I8c63fe6b8c5de74eac3f3c259783bb946e0482a0
Closes-Bug: #1608596

so it's plural given it's a list and not a single security
group.

subject: Only use parameter_defaults for scaling down
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-11 17:43:07.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/actions/test_scale.py', 'tripleo_common/actions/scale.py'], 'message': "Only use parameter_defaults for scaling down

We were using parameters for scaling down but parameter_defaults for
scaling up. The old parameters from scale-down still persisted in the
stack and took precedence over the scaled-up parameter_defaults, so the
scaled-up values didn't propagate.

We already update parameter_defaults in the deployment plan in that same
method, so all we need to do is remove the 'parameters' part.

Change-Id: I90a195a66b15c7c9057bfb415b6a730bbd9a939c
Closes-Bug: #1641142
"}]
commit_message:
Only use parameter_defaults for scaling down

We were using parameters for scaling down but parameter_defaults for
scaling up. The old parameters from scale-down still persisted in the
stack and took precedence over the scaled-up parameter_defaults, so the
scaled-up values didn't propagate.

We already update parameter_defaults in the deployment plan in that same
method, so all we need to do is remove the 'parameters' part.

Change-Id: I90a195a66b15c7c9057bfb415b6a730bbd9a939c
Closes-Bug: #1641142

commit_message:
Switch to xenial-based grenade multinode jobs (w/ and w/o dvr) for newton and above

The jobs were introduced recently but proved green right off the bat [1,2]. Since
newton and master branches automatically pin jobs to xenial, it makes sense to
add these next to their trusty counterparts so that we don't lose coverage in master
and newton branches.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/41/394741/3/experimental/gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode-ubuntu-xenial-nv/0e1b070/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/41/394741/3/experimental/gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-dvr-multinode-ubuntu-xenial-nv/782393b/

Change-Id: Id89f3b46e775b8b0f2c31c2572f9942ec2755996

commit_message:
Soft-delete consoles while deleting instance

When you delete instance, it doesn't mark consoles as soft-deleted
which raises IntegrityError when you archive instances db table.

This patch makes sure to soft-delete consoles at the time of
destroying instances.

Closes-Bug: #1596933
Change-Id: Icb8dd01a3c9cdd5b71dabb5fb79225f3a72c68d6

commit_message:
Replace ceilometer-dbsync by ceilometer-upgrade

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/388688/ has removed ceilometer-dbsync
and ceilometer-upgrade must be used instead.

Additionally, ceilometer-dbsync enabled option --skip-gnocchi-resource-types
and ceilometer-upgrade doesn't, so i'm setting it by default to
ensure backwards compatibility.

Closes-Bug: #1641076

Change-Id: I383fb7922e7984b067742e10a370b0d2f574dbe9

subject: Refactor abstract logic+models out of OVS driver
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-22 17:20:52.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/services/sfc/drivers/ovs/constants.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/plugin.py', 'networking_sfc/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/expand/008018ca14b7_move_abstractions_to_the_plugin.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/agent/agent.py', 'doc/source/api.rst', 'networking_sfc/db/sfc_db.py', 'networking_sfc/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/EXPAND_HEAD', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/drivers/ovs/db.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/drivers/ovs/driver.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/drivers/ovs/rpc.py', 'networking_sfc/services/sfc/common/constants.py'], 'message': 'Refactor abstract logic+models out of OVS driver

This patch refactors all logic and models that are abstract in SFC, and
not specific to the OVS driver, moving them out of the OVS driver.
It also updates the OVS driver so that it only manages OVS-specific
resources and not the abstract plugin resources.

This allows Service Function Path IDs and identifiers to be managed and
generated in the networking-sfc plugin itself, instead of inside the
OVS driver, so that any driver can reuse these SFP allocations.

[WIP]
This is a work-in-progress and is missing the following at this time:
- Updated tests;
- A working Update Port Chain - the plugin/driver interface is not
  ideal to carry out the update of an existing port chain, due to the
  split into abstract plugin resources and specific [OVS] resources.
  As such, more discussion with the team should be held to decide the
  best way to approach this, potentially by modifying the plugin/driver
  interface;
- Hands-on validation of instantiating more than 1 port-chain;
- Potentially change migration path - and discuss implications
  of it since a lot of tables are being changed subtractively;
- Other planned code changes.

Closes-Bug: #1588460

Change-Id: I65bc3a8cbe6a542e53e3a9b5206d082fed1ef820
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor abstract logic+models out of OVS driver

This patch refactors all logic and models that are abstract in SFC, and
not specific to the OVS driver, moving them out of the OVS driver.
It also updates the OVS driver so that it only manages OVS-specific
resources and not the abstract plugin resources.

This allows Service Function Path IDs and identifiers to be managed and
generated in the networking-sfc plugin itself, instead of inside the
OVS driver, so that any driver can reuse these SFP allocations.

[WIP]
This is a work-in-progress and is missing the following at this time:
- Updated tests;
- A working Update Port Chain - the plugin/driver interface is not
  ideal to carry out the update of an existing port chain, due to the
  split into abstract plugin resources and specific [OVS] resources.
  As such, more discussion with the team should be held to decide the
  best way to approach this, potentially by modifying the plugin/driver
  interface;
- Hands-on validation of instantiating more than 1 port-chain;
- Potentially change migration path - and discuss implications
  of it since a lot of tables are being changed subtractively;
- Other planned code changes.

Closes-Bug: #1588460

Change-Id: I65bc3a8cbe6a542e53e3a9b5206d082fed1ef820

This job feels like an exception as no other neutron subproject has
veto over neutron patches. It was added to provide a weather bell
for potential breaking changes, but quite some time has gone since
then and we have become a lot better at spotting/dealing with bumps

commit_message:
Remove gate-neutron-lbaasv2-dsvm-minimal from neutron check queue

This job feels like an exception as no other neutron subproject has
veto over neutron patches. It was added to provide a weather bell
for potential breaking changes, but quite some time has gone since
then and we have become a lot better at spotting/dealing with bumps
in the road. It is only fair to treat lbaas as any other project and
take this job off the neutron queue.

Change-Id: I0ef4df6d48874003fcd94899a43d8e8bc2a7b63d

commit_message:
Correctly point to Task Statuses from Tasks doc.

This is a doc improvement to point the Task Statuses link in
tasks.html to the correct 'Task Statuses' section inside
status.html. Currently, this link points to the 'Image Statuses'
section instead of 'Task Statuses'. This patch addresses that.

Change-Id: Iaf877a48f92aec9e789809fb5f4b9be0ca0e23cf
Closes-Bug: 1622779

commit_message:
Update api-ref with 409 response to image update.

With the change [1] that went into Newton to disallow image location
updates except for 'queued' and 'active' states, this patch adds
appropriate api-ref documentation. Related change [2] bumps the minor
API version to 2.4.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/324012
[2] https://review.openstack.org/350809

Change-Id: I593ad2d3c7402c4fb87a475c8d44060baed5ff69
Closes-Bug: 1621236

commit_message:
Convert DIB elements from Fedora to CentOS7

This change converts the existing Fedora elements to CentOS 7
(centos7).  It expands the current set of mariadb, mongodb, mysql,
percona, postgresql, and redis to also include cassandra, couchbase,
and pxc. Couchdb, Vertica, and DB2 are currently excluded due to
the lack of public yum repos or rpms for those databases. Another
tenet of this change is that the database packages installed are
strictly from vendor yum repos where available, and not installed
from CentOS 7 distro repos (including EPEL). Versions were selected
for parity with current Ubuntu elements where applicable.

Change-Id: Iddf2f59be7f2fb4b5aed9653748cb314619e4846
Closes-Bug: #1586510

commit_message:
fix delete backup tenant_id error

When we use a api to delete a backup instance,
we should give a tenant_id to decrease quota.
But in the code,the tenant_id that invoke the api,
not the backup instance belongs,so recorrect it.

Close-Bug: #1546935
Change-Id: Ie476b36f75fc5313b97be23cfdb2d7b66f4734db

commit_message:
Make timeouts datastore specific

Copied timeout parameters to individual datastores to make them
individually configurable for each datastore.

Also, obsoleted the globals. Changed all usages and replaced access
to use the datastore value while ignoring the common value.

Updated trove test configuration file.

Release note has been added.

Author: William Criswell <wc2912@att.com>
Committer: William Criswell <wc2912@att.com>
Change-Id: I13fedebc9e26caacbcb1cc4908940a91a4b7272b
Closes-bug: #1529622

commit_message:
Show flavor name instead of ID in show_instance

This change makes "trove show" command will show
flavor name of the instance instead of flavor ID.
This helps users to understand the instance's
flavor intuitively.

Closes-Bug: #1619517
Change-Id: Id7817551422e150fde108b10ceb7c5ac00580b40

commit_message:
[DNM] Sample lower-constraints.txt

This ia actually a lower-constraints.txt which is pretty simple to generate.

There are a few lower bounds that don't even exist on pypi anymore :(

 - PuLP: 1.0.4 not available changing to 1.4.1
 - ldap3: 0.9.8.2 not available changing to 0.9.8.7.post1
 - PrettyTable: 0.7 not available changing to 0.7.1
 - pyldap: 2.4 not available changing to 2.4.20
 - pyngus: 2.0.0 not available changing to 2.0.2
 - PyYAML: 3.1.0 not available changing to 3.10
 - rtslib-fb: 2.1.41 not available changing to 2.1.43
 - XStatic-Bootstrap-SCSS: 3 not available changing to 3.1.1.1
 - XStatic-jQuery: 1.7.2 not available changing to 1.8.2.1
 - XStatic-jquery-ui: 1.10.1 not available changing to 1.10.4.1
 - XStatic-term.js: 0.0.4 not available changing to 0.0.4.1

Also the minimum versions for:
 - simplejson
 - xattr
 - cliff-tablib
 - testresources
 - couchdb

Don't build under py3.  Rather than split the minimum based py pythn_version
it's better to just pick a version for each that works in both environments.

Change-Id: I6732d733df9f72b4414cce4244975394aae33a53

commit_message:
Reduce code duplication

Reduced source code by extracting duplicated code.
There are some "Ctrl-C + Ctrl-V" code. These code are identical
(restoring database from backup), so I created a new function in
parent class and I called this method in "old positions".
There are different results:
Trove: http://openqa.sed.hu/dashboard/index/index?did=1&id=OpenStack%3Atrove

Change-Id: I02be6fbbfba0c26b4f1ce78bd5da3d844f8d1345
Closes-Bug: 1606829

subject: Fix copying nfs_shares configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-11 19:33:35.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/cinder/tasks/config.yml'], 'message': 'Fix copying nfs_shares configuration

Using the `when` conditional on a `with_` loop gets evaluated on each
loop iteration and will not skip a task entirely. Use the `skip`
attribute to ignore errors in this scenario but only `skip` when
`enable_cinder_backend_nfs` is not enabled. If it is enabled the
`nfs_shares` file should be required and this task should fail if it
does not exist.

Co-authored-by: Andrew Widdersheim <amwiddersheim@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6b997dd943efe7b16beb63899c1488fa5353d996
Closes-Bug: #1641183
'}]
commit_message:
Fix copying nfs_shares configuration

Using the `when` conditional on a `with_` loop gets evaluated on each
loop iteration and will not skip a task entirely. Use the `skip`
attribute to ignore errors in this scenario but only `skip` when
`enable_cinder_backend_nfs` is not enabled. If it is enabled the
`nfs_shares` file should be required and this task should fail if it
does not exist.

Co-authored-by: Andrew Widdersheim <amwiddersheim@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6b997dd943efe7b16beb63899c1488fa5353d996
Closes-Bug: #1641183

subject: libvirt: fix serial console not correctly defined after live-migration
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 24, 'name': 'Chuck Short', 'email': 'charles.short@windriver.com', 'username': 'zulcss'}, {'_account_id': 6608, 'name': 'Paul Carlton', 'email': 'paul.carlton2@hpe.com', 'username': 'paul-carlton2'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 12299, 'name': 'Paweł Koniszewski', 'email': 'pawel.koniszewski@gmail.com', 'username': 'pawel.koniszewski'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 16:06:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: fix serial console not correctly defined after live-migration

During post live migration the XML defined in libvirt does not contain
the definition of serial ports. That is because we call the method
get_guest_config_xml to retrieve the XML definition which is not going
to return a definition of serial ports because the instance already
define them. Actually calling this method to retrieve domain XML of an
instance is not good in every cases because the aim of that method is
to define a domain XML not to return a domain XML, for that purpose we
prefer to call XMLDesc(0).

Also that commit is removing the process to write into a file the
domain XML which is not used anymore. libvirtd is storing the XML
definition of domains by itself (see: guest.write_instance_config())

Closes-Bug: #1614019
Change-Id: I230031bba3926171a80ae773a98280ac5c61058b
(cherry picked from commit dccaf9cb88705b2a635c5b54433c5e6187557849)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: fix serial console not correctly defined after live-migration

During post live migration the XML defined in libvirt does not contain
the definition of serial ports. That is because we call the method
get_guest_config_xml to retrieve the XML definition which is not going
to return a definition of serial ports because the instance already
define them. Actually calling this method to retrieve domain XML of an
instance is not good in every cases because the aim of that method is
to define a domain XML not to return a domain XML, for that purpose we
prefer to call XMLDesc(0).

Also that commit is removing the process to write into a file the
domain XML which is not used anymore. libvirtd is storing the XML
definition of domains by itself (see: guest.write_instance_config())

Closes-Bug: #1614019
Change-Id: I230031bba3926171a80ae773a98280ac5c61058b
(cherry picked from commit dccaf9cb88705b2a635c5b54433c5e6187557849)

commit_message:
Fix 500 error for showing deleted flavor details

Displaying deleted flavor details throws 500 internal server error.
Added 404 HttpNotFound status code in "@extension.expected_errors".

APIImpact: Return 404 status code for list extra specs
for a deleted flavor.

Closes-Bug: #1538896

Change-Id: Iba33296c28c3c3d6ba60052fe434107ac9c00c61
(cherry picked from commit 4184f985011ddcca08ae695bb9793794037a0b04)

commit_message:
Fixes Env Rest Api unit tests failures in mitaka-py27 Gate Test.

Currently, in mitaka-py27 gate test, 6 unit tests fail in
muranodashboard.tests.unit.environments.test_rest_api
because the setUp methods try to access a nonexistent
variable PARAM_MAPPING in muranodashboard.api.rest.utils.

Change-Id: Ic8e35dc9da22ecd90bc3034e9c4d5fe0ffc597f9
Closes-Bug: #1641221

commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of
assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or assertEqual(type(A), B).
The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A, B) provided
by testtools

Change-Id: Ic6be6e291c8afb125d12ec94df81d0f338495001

Change-Id: Iebbe5f0da4cd5b9d1d1673e55ac986170de20241
'}]
commit_message:
Fine tuning features to run ironic on tempest

Tempest historically avoid running some tests for features unsupported by ironic
when it is enabled on the environment, but instead we should be controlling
which features should be enabled when ironic is setup.

Change-Id: Iebbe5f0da4cd5b9d1d1673e55ac986170de20241

commit_message:
Adds Unity Cinder Driver

This driver supports both FC and iSCSI protocols and
supports below operations:
 - Ceate / Delete volume
 - Extend volume
 - Attach / Detach volume
 - Create / Delete snapshot
 - Copy Image to Volume
 - Copy Volume to Image
 - Clone volume
 - Create volume from snapshot

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Cedric Zhuang <cedric.zhuang@emc.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryan Liang <ryan.liang@emc.com>
Implements: blueprint emc-unity-driver

Change-Id: Iccf899cb8d6cacbd5eaccf2e828611f271960040

'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23950, 'name': 'Eric Xie', 'email': 'eric_xiett@163.com', 'username': 'ericxie'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-09 19:57:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': "Instance obj_clone leaves metadata as changed

When performing an obj_clone on an Instance object, it relies on the
base obj_clone's deep copy method which just goes through all of the
fields and duplicates them on the clone.  However, the Instance object
has internal tracking attributes for metadata and system_metadata that
keep track of which keys have changed.  Since these don't get copied
over on the deep copy, these will show up as having changed on the
cloned Instance (if they had metadata set originally) and on a save
on this cloned object will end up updating the metadata in the db
which if these have stale information will wipe out other changes.

Such a scenario to this is occurring during build_instance where the
Claim constructor is saving off a clone of the Instance object
so that it will have the current copy.  In the case of a failure
during the build_instance, the claim will use this current copy
to then set the value of the host on the instance to None.  Since
the clone reflects that the system_metadata has changed, it will
as part of the save try to update the system_metadata in the db,
which since it is stale will wipe out changes made.

In the case of the issue being fixed here, the value in the
system_metdata being wiped out is the network_allocated=True
attribute.  By this being wiped out then reschedules of that
build_instance fail in cases where the IP address has been
assigned to the instance.

Change-Id: Ie49a90993fb9643c04d75402dbaaa933c6b5222e
Closes-Bug: #1639230
"}]
commit_message:
Instance obj_clone leaves metadata as changed

When performing an obj_clone on an Instance object, it relies on the
base obj_clone's deep copy method which just goes through all of the
fields and duplicates them on the clone.  However, the Instance object
has internal tracking attributes for metadata and system_metadata that
keep track of which keys have changed.  Since these don't get copied
over on the deep copy, these will show up as having changed on the
cloned Instance (if they had metadata set originally) and on a save
on this cloned object will end up updating the metadata in the db
which if these have stale information will wipe out other changes.

Such a scenario to this is occurring during build_instance where the
Claim constructor is saving off a clone of the Instance object
so that it will have the current copy.  In the case of a failure
during the build_instance, the claim will use this current copy
to then set the value of the host on the instance to None.  Since
the clone reflects that the system_metadata has changed, it will
as part of the save try to update the system_metadata in the db,
which since it is stale will wipe out changes made.

In the case of the issue being fixed here, the value in the
system_metdata being wiped out is the network_allocated=True
attribute.  By this being wiped out then reschedules of that
build_instance fail in cases where the IP address has been
assigned to the instance.

Change-Id: Ie49a90993fb9643c04d75402dbaaa933c6b5222e
Closes-Bug: #1639230

commit_message:
Add support for ethtool_opts option

This patch add an optional option to specify
the ETHTOOL_OPTS for each interface.

ETHTOOL_OPTS option will be written to the ifcfg file.

Change-Id: I6b594e89ba6b4c17e8df79def997f6c9ea427a3a

subject: PCI: Fix PCI with fully qualified address
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17973, 'name': 'Ludovic Beliveau', 'email': 'lbeliveau@gmail.com', 'username': 'lbeliveau'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-04 12:37:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/pci/devspec.py', 'nova/tests/unit/pci/test_devspec.py'], 'message': "PCI: Fix PCI with fully qualified address

Specifying a PF passthrough device in the pci_passthrough_whitelist using its
fully qualified PCI address (no wildcard) causes the device to not be
properly loaded.  The PCI device is then not available to be assigned to any
guest.

In this case, the hypervisor reports the PF device without a 'parent_addr'.
But in the PciAddress, match() is using it when doing the comparison to its
own address.

This commit changes the logic of the address matching method in PciDevSpec to
only try to match the address with a physical function device when a
'parent_addr' is reported by the hypervisor.

Change-Id: I5255240871d8ad5c216500f39520339efe46e84b
Closes-Bug: #1613434
(cherry picked from commit d38d5767d15b24df455b1844dfe53ada2ebf9751)
"}]
commit_message:
PCI: Fix PCI with fully qualified address

Specifying a PF passthrough device in the pci_passthrough_whitelist using its
fully qualified PCI address (no wildcard) causes the device to not be
properly loaded.  The PCI device is then not available to be assigned to any
guest.

In this case, the hypervisor reports the PF device without a 'parent_addr'.
But in the PciAddress, match() is using it when doing the comparison to its
own address.

This commit changes the logic of the address matching method in PciDevSpec to
only try to match the address with a physical function device when a
'parent_addr' is reported by the hypervisor.

Change-Id: I5255240871d8ad5c216500f39520339efe46e84b
Closes-Bug: #1613434
(cherry picked from commit d38d5767d15b24df455b1844dfe53ada2ebf9751)
